title: Riot should do more with Runes to encourage interesting gameplay, not just kills
body:
With runes reforged, we got lots of cool runes that stack up rewards. The problem is, most of these runes ONLY stack when you get kills.

Why don't the stacking runes work off of tower kills, or epic monster kills?

I understand CS not being a good stat to allow them to stack, because that would encourage uninteractive laning, but at the very least give people some equal motivation so that towers and epic monsters are weighed at least a little bit against kills!

_Edit: Somebody brought up the example of Eyeball collector. This does stack with ward kills, but it's not exactly accessible to everyone like the kill stacking ones are. Kill stacking runes are present in multiple rune trees, while the ward related ones are only present in Domination._

replies.body: I mean this rewards interactive gameplay and taking risks. you can easily just get a stack by getting a kill yourself on the target that is trying to kill you right. Eyeballs get stacked on ward kills and large monsters anyway and I believe even assists get you stacks.

Taking objectives is risky. I think it would benefit the game as a whole to reward other forms of risks besides just trying to kill enemy champions.

That's true about ward kills, but it's not exactly accessible to everyone like the kill stacking ones are. Kill stacking runes are present in many of the trees, while the ward related ones are only present in Domination.

In low Elo no one cares for objectives or prepares for them. Even in plat 4 I had a jax continuously gank top because "yorick was INTING like a mofo". We lost dragons, he didnt gank mid even as I am pressed against my tower and our bot lane was getting destroyed.

That's not just a low ELO thing. It's common practice to gank the lane that is snowballing in order to get the ball rolling even harder. I assume that Yorick was on the enemy team?

The only thing low ELO about that situation was the jungler ignoring the dragons.

No Yorick was on our team feeding the enemy trydamere lol. I ended up being the strongest lane and beating out Ahri mid, but I wasnt stronger than that trydamere. Which is why I find it odd in Plat people still do Bronzie moves.
Oh, hmm. I have no idea wtf your jungler was doing then. Maybe they duo'd with Yorick. That's a common cause for that.

I do not believe so as this Jax was hard flaming this Yorick so bad. and then Yorick started clearing his whole jungle when Jax died to his lane. It was some of the most toxic stuff I have ever seen. reminded me of my bronze days way back when.
Oh, ick. I'm sorry you had to deal with that.
well its league you learn to live with it.
Or delete the runes that stack with kill and just give us a flat bonus of some kind instead?

Runes that stack are still a good way to reward players for making plays, it's better to have stacking that stacks equally for various kinds of plays than it is to remove stacking entirely just because it's only kills that currently earn stacks.

People hav cared more about kills than objectives for years. It's mainly because games with TDM modes usually flaunt a players KDA somewhere on their profile and because that's apparently an online status symbol people would rather pad their KDA than win in most FPS games. 

Then there's league, which exploded with popularity, bringing in that crowd. Yes Riot and other sites display KDA, with most agreeing that 3.0 is good, but focusing only on kills doesn't win games in LoL. Which is why Riot tried to make kills less impactful once upon a time, less FB gold, more global tower gold, the first dragon update, etc. But people complainted that objectives were too important and games became 40 minute farm simulators so Riot slowly attempted to push league into a "hey, fight" playstyle which brings us to the current meta.

I would say that the current meta isn't much better in terms of fun, slow games were certainly frustrating, but now we've swung full circle to having games decided way too early and people being forced to fight even when they're behind.

Riot has always wanted to make kills important and relevant because they want LoL to be fun and exciting rather than pure strategy being totally dominant. The game was originally marketed as more action oriented than DotA.
Including towers and epic monsters in the list of available means of stacking doesn't threaten that at all, if anything it will increase competition over objectives and lanes.
